_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy



The owners, management and employees of Farmers Union Oil (the facility) are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.



2.  Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application for crop production nutrients.



3.  Worst-Case Scenario and Alternate Release Scenario



NOT INCLUDED for security reasons.



4.  Accidental Release Prevention Program



The facility has been reviewed for general compliance with the provisions of ANSI/CGA G-2.1-2014 "Rquirements for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia", the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia", and ND state regulations.



5.  Five-Year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or enviromental damage.



6.  Emergency Response Program



As a non-responding facility, this facility:



(a).  has prepared a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;



(b).  provides state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA); and



(c).  has coordinated emergency response with public responders.



7.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to ass
ess the maintenance of safe conditions.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
